page.title: 03A FARMER'S DAY
page.content:
I get up at 6.30. After milking, which takes about 2 hours, I take the cows out into the fields and then go in for breakfast.
I wash all the milking parlour equipment and circulate all the milking line with boiling water and detergent, then clean out the cowsheds. For the rest of the day I work in the fields and repair machinery until milking time again in the evening.
When the young stock and sheep and lambs are out in the fields, I have to check them every day to make sure they are all well. In winter, we keep the sheep and the stock inside. Nearly all the time is taken up feeding and looking after them.
